resources.string: Cox\'s Bazar Beach, located at Cox\'s Bazar, Bangladesh, is the longest natural sea beach in the world running 120 kilometres and 5th longest beach after Praia do Cassino of Brazil, Padre Island on the US Gulf Coast, Eighty Mile Beach in Western Australia, and Ninety Mile Beach of Australia
Chandranath Pahar is a hill located in Sitakunda, Chittagong, offering breathtaking views and a spiritual atmosphere.
Guliakhali Sea Beach is a serene coastal area in Bangladesh, providing a tranquil escape and picturesque views.

Saint Martin\'s Island is a picturesque coral island located in the Bay of Bengal. It is renowned for its pristine beaches, crystal-clear turquoise waters, and diverse marine life. The island offers opportunities for snorkeling, diving, and exploring vibrant coral reefs. Visitors can relish delicious seafood, witness stunning sunsets, and experience the tranquil island atmosphere. Saint Martin\'s Island is a paradise for nature lovers and a perfect escape from the bustling city life.

Patenga Sea Beach is a popular beach destination in Chittagong, Bangladesh. It is known for its long stretch of sandy shores, gentle waves, and scenic beauty. Visitors can enjoy leisurely walks along the beach, indulge in local street food, and capture mesmerizing sunsets. The beach also offers horse riding and boat trips for a fun-filled experience. Patenga Sea Beach is a favorite spot for locals and tourists alike, providing a refreshing coastal retreat.

Kaptai Lake is a man-made reservoir located in the Rangamati Hill District of Bangladesh. It is surrounded by lush green hills and dense forests, creating a scenic and serene environment. The lake offers boat rides, allowing visitors to explore its vast expanse and enjoy the breathtaking views. Kaptai Lake is also home to various indigenous tribal communities, offering a glimpse into their traditional way of life. The combination of natural beauty and cultural richness makes Kaptai Lake a must-visit destination for nature enthusiasts and cultural explorers.

Buddha Dhatu Jadi, also known as the Bandarban Golden Temple, is a magnificent Buddhist temple located in Bandarban, Bangladesh. The temple features stunning architecture adorned with intricate designs, colorful decorations, and golden accents. It houses a large golden statue of Lord Buddha, surrounded by beautiful gardens and serene surroundings. Visitors can immerse themselves in the peaceful ambiance, explore the temple complex, and gain insights into Buddhist teachings and practices. Buddha Dhatu Jadi is a spiritual and cultural landmark, offering a serene and enlightening experience.

Radiant Fish World is a unique aquatic attraction situated in Dhaka, Bangladesh. It is a paradise for fish enthusiasts and nature lovers alike. The world-class aquarium showcases a wide range of exotic and colorful fish species from around the world. Visitors can marvel at the vibrant underwater world, observe fascinating marine life, and learn about different aquatic ecosystems. Radiant Fish World also offers educational exhibits, interactive displays, and informative presentations. It is a captivating destination that combines entertainment, education, and appreciation for the beauty of marine life.
Ahsan Manzil Museum is a historical palace located in Dhaka. It showcases the rich cultural heritage of Bangladesh.
Lalbagh Fort is a Mughal fort complex in Dhaka. It is an architectural marvel with beautiful gardens and structures.
The Bangladesh National Parliament is the supreme legislative body of the country. It is an iconic symbol of democracy.
Sonargaon Museum is a historical site in Dhaka. It showcases the rich history and culture of the region.
Bangabandhu Safari Park is a wildlife park in Gazipur. It is home to various species of animals and offers an exciting safari experience.
Bangabandhu Military Museum is a museum dedicated to the armed forces of Bangladesh. It showcases the country\'s military history.
Taj Mahal Bangladesh is a replica of the iconic Taj Mahal in India. It is a beautiful architectural masterpiece.
Hatir Jheel is a popular lake and recreational area in Dhaka. It offers boating and other activities for visitors.
Welcome to the Bangladesh Tourist Guider App!

Our app aims to provide you with a comprehensive guide to explore the rich cultural heritage, natural beauty, and historical landmarks of Bangladesh. Whether you\'re a local resident or a visitor from abroad, our app is designed to enhance your travel experience and make your journey through Bangladesh memorable. Discover the hidden gems of Bangladesh through our carefully curated collection of destinations, including stunning beaches, historical sites, vibrant cities, serene rivers, and picturesque landscapes. Our app offers detailed information about each location, including its significance, historical background, cultural significance, and must-visit attractions. Navigate through our interactive maps and find your way to your desired destinations effortlessly. Our user-friendly interface ensures easy access to information, making it convenient for you to plan your itinerary and explore the wonders of Bangladesh at your own pace. Stay updated with the latest news, events, and festivals happening across the country. Our app provides valuable insights into local traditions, cuisines, and customs, allowing you to immerse yourself in the true essence of Bangladesh.
Happy exploring!\n\nThe Bangladesh Tourist Guider App Team

It is among the largest waterfalls in the country by volume of water falling. The wild hilly Remaikree river suddenly falls down here about 25–30 feet or 7.62-9.144 meters. The word Ngafa (ঙাফা) in native Marma language means Baghair fish/ Dwarf goonch and "Khong" means "Ground
Shundarban is a mangrove forest in Bangladesh known for its rich biodiversity. It is home to the Royal Bengal Tiger and offers breathtaking natural beauty.
The Sixty Domed Mosque in Bagerhat, Bangladesh, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is an architectural masterpiece and a symbol of the region\'s rich history and cultural heritage.
Khan Jahan Ali\'s Mosque is a historic mosque located in Bagerhat, Bangladesh. It was built in the 15th century and is renowned for its unique architectural design.
Khondla Math Temple, also known as Kodla Moth, is an ancient Hindu temple located in Rajshahi, Bangladesh. It showcases exquisite terracotta artwork and is a significant religious site.
Lalon Shah\'s Mazar is the shrine of the famous mystic poet and philosopher, Lalon Shah. Located in Kushtia, Bangladesh, it attracts devotees and visitors seeking spiritual solace.

Rabindra Kuthibari, also known as Shilaidaha Kuthibadi, is a historic mansion in Kushtia, Bangladesh, where Nobel laureate Rabindranath Tagore resided. It serves as a cultural heritage site and a museum.
The Puthia Temple Complex is a collection of Hindu temples located in Puthia, Rajshahi. It is renowned for its stunning architecture and intricate designs.
The Ruins of the Buddhist Vihara are ancient remains of a Buddhist monastery. They provide a glimpse into the rich Buddhist heritage of the region.
Mohasthan Garh is an archaeological site in Bogura, known for its historical significance. It is believed to be one of the earliest urban archaeological sites in Bangladesh.
The Choto Shona Mosque is a small but beautiful mosque located in Bagerhat. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and showcases the region\'s rich architectural heritage.
Baitul Aman Jame Masjid is a beautiful mosque located in Guthia, Bangladesh.
Kuakata Sea Beach is a popular tourist destination known for its scenic beauty and stunning sunset views.
Floating Guava Market is a unique market located in Bangladesh, where guavas are sold on boats floating in the water.
Jakob Tower is a prominent landmark and observation tower situated in Bangladesh, offering panoramic views of the surrounding area.
Visit the revered Hazrat Shahjalal Mazar in Sylhet, Bangladesh.
Explore the stunning Sada Pathor in Sylhet, Bangladesh.
Discover the enchanting beauty of Jaflong in Sylhet, Bangladesh.
Experience the breathtaking Lalakhal in Sylhet, Bangladesh.
Immerse yourself in the lush greenery of Ratargul Swamp Forest in Sylhet, Bangladesh.
Visit the scenic Malnichhera Tea Garden in Sylhet, Bangladesh.

Experience the breathtaking beauty of Tanguar Haor, a unique wetland ecosystem and a paradise for nature lovers and birdwatchers. Located in Sunamganj, Bangladesh, Tanguar Haor is famous for its serene water bodies, lush greenery, and diverse wildlife. Explore the tranquil surroundings, take a boat ride through the crystal-clear waters, and witness the vibrant birdlife, including migratory birds during the winter season. Tanguar Haor is not only a natural wonder but also holds cultural significance as a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve. Immerse yourself in the enchanting beauty of Tanguar Haor and discover the harmony between nature and humanity.
Tajhat Palace is a historical palace located in Rangpur, Bangladesh. It is known for its impressive architecture and cultural significance, reflecting the rich heritage of the region.

Kantajew Temple is a renowned Hindu temple situated in Dinajpur, Bangladesh. It is celebrated for its intricate terracotta artwork and exquisite architecture, making it a significant religious and cultural site.

Shopnopuri Artificial Amusement Park is a popular recreational park located in Dinajpur, Bangladesh. It offers various exciting rides, entertainment facilities, and picturesque surroundings, providing a fun-filled experience for visitors of all ages.

Madhutila Eco Park is a beautiful ecological park located in Bangladesh. It offers stunning natural landscapes, lush greenery, and a variety of flora and fauna. Visitors can enjoy activities such as nature walks, bird watching, and picnics in a serene environment.

China Matir Pahar is a scenic hill in Bangladesh known for its unique clay formations. The hill offers breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape and is a popular destination for nature lovers and photography enthusiasts.

Bangladesh is without doubt one of Asia’s undiscovered gems, but unfortunately (mostly due to a mixture of political instability and natural disasters), Bangladesh has gathered not the best reputation internationally. Bangladesh has yet to experience much tourism and is mostly un-touristed: a foreign face will excite a lot of attention and interest, almost always of a friendly and kindly nature. “Excuse me mam, your country?” were probably the words I heard spoken most to me on my trip. As an un-touristed destination, Bangladesh is relatively free from the tourist-scams that are common in neighbouring India. On the other hand, Bangladesh also lacks much of the infrastructure of neighbouring India, and travelling around can be hard work. Roads can be unpaved, traffic is dire in some places (mostly Dhaka) – for more see the transport section – and transport conditions are basic at best. English is not widely spoken, which can make independent travel difficult in more rural areas. Bangladesh can also be raw: along with the beautiful landscapes, people and places, expect to see a lot of poverty, and a huge amount of pollution and dirt. Don’t come if you’re not comfortable with dressing conservatively, sitting in crowded transport, and experiencing a variety of conditions. Perhaps the best description of Bangladesh I’ve heard is a “more raw version of India” – but even that comparison falls a long way short of the variety and richness of culture available in Bangladesh, and the positive surprises that this small but bustling country has in store for travellers who make it there.
